channel.title: Server online cost?
channel.description: does it cost to put your server online for like 5-10 friends?

item.title: Server online cost?
item.dc:creator: @Skill_3D Skill 3D
item.description:
@Skill_3D wrote:

AtomicInt_:

What the fuck are you talking about?

Sorry I just had to quote this, LMFAO.

As for your problem, you can either purchase a VPS, which is Virtual Private Server, it’s basically a computer hosted elsewhere that you rent per month and you connect to it from your computer via RDC (Remote Desktop Connection) or a 3rd-party application. With the minimum required specs for a private server with 10-15 users it would cost about $26.00/Month for a Windows VPS (recommended). So somewhere from $26.00 - $32.00 USD.

If you don’t want to play that much and you don’t want to have the server on all the time, you can host it from your computer and portforward the application in your router, and if it’s with your friends you don’t really need to use No-IP as it’s just a middle-man to protect your IP a bit more. You would just edit the client.java file or GUI.java file and change the server IP from 127.0.0.1/Localhost/0.0.0.0 to whatever your IP is (www.whatsmyip.org). To portforward follow these instructions.

On a Windows computer go to Start and then ‘Run…’
Type in cmd and press enter, this will launch a black box.
In the box type ipconfig, this will get the local ip address for your computer.
You’ll see something like this:

Connection-specific DNS Suffix . :
IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.###
Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0
Default Gateway. . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.1

You’re going to want the number it say for IP Address, this is the local IP within your home network for your computer specifically. Now go to 192.168.1.1 in any web browser (could sometimes be 192.168.0.1) and type in the router username and password (usually admin;password (or) admin;admin). Then find somewhere were it says Portforwarding, on the page enter in your local ip from run/cmd/ipconfig, and port is 43594 (usually), and select TCP/UDP (Both).

If that is confusing, just look for a tutorial. If you need help setting it up or references on website that sell VPS’ just let me know via Private Message or something.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

babushkahead:

is there a way of it being free for just me and my mates? like 3 of them and whats cpu?

CPU stands for central processing unit.

[quote=“I am Nick, post:16, topic:448669”][quote author=babushkahead link=topic=551554.msg4042474#msg4042474 date=1341778645]
im not an administrator on my computor and i dont know my password for my bt account when i type in my ip
[/quote]
Lol if you are not the administrator of your computer you are probably not old enough to be hosting a private server.[/quote]

Where are you getting this from? This is one of the most ridiculous things I’ve ever read on MoparScape.

babushkahead:

my parents wont tell me also i entered the password on my hub still didnt work?

Try googling the default password for your router, or try to convince your parents to give it to you.

item.title: Server online cost?
item.dc:creator: @Mario_PvP Mario PvP
item.description:
@Mario_PvP wrote:

you need to run your computer when you want to play, if you dont want to play you turn off your computer.

you need to portforward the port 43594.
for a tutorial go to portforward.com
to check if it worked, go to this site and do the instructions. canyouseeme.org
you can use a no-ip or just use your IP. no-ip simply renames your IP.
to do that go to no-ip.com sign up, log in, add host, make your ip just leave the settings. now thats done, you need to download the ip duc. after you have done that log in(in ip duc).
leave settings just V the ip you got.
Now players should be able to play

Read full topic
